attributes.action: Vaccinate teachers and early years workers as a priority.
attributes.background: Teachers and early years workers are being turned away from vaccination centres despite being in desperate need of protection against covid-19. The government needs to acknowledge teachers and early years workers as essential frontline workers who should be granted a vaccination as soon as able.
attributes.additional_details: Teachers and early years workers are looking after children every day, children who are coming from the homes of frontline workers and therefore could be carrying the virus. The government seem to have taken the stance that teachers do not need the vaccination perhaps because of children being of a lower prevalence for the virus, however they are also in contact with parents everyday and are unable to distance from the children due to the nature of their job. They need the vaccination.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554316

attributes.action: Stop the closure of homeopathic and naturopathic practices during the pandemic.
attributes.background: Alternative medical practices such as Homeopathy, Acupuncture and Osteopathy should be allowed to continue to operate face to face during the pandemic. Both have offered many the support they have needed throughout. I’ve been raised on natural medicine and only known positive and effective care.
attributes.additional_details: Homeopathy and acupuncture are both safe and natural systems of medicine. Many people are sceptical of the impact of homeopathy, osteopathy and acupuncture as often people work to disprove it. These are some of the longest standing forms of therapeutic and medical treatments. Studies in Cuba have proved that homeopathic remedies provide the preventative care needed against Covid-19. By shutting these practices across the UK you, the government, are further silencing the practice.

rejection.details:
Businesses providing dental services, opticians, audiology services, chiropody, chiropractors, osteopaths and other medical or health services, including services relating to mental health are allowed to remain open during the current national lockdown: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/closing-certain-businesses-and-venues-in-england

The Complementary and Natural Healthcare Council has stated that it believes this means that its registrants in England meet the definition of  “other…health services, including services relating to mental health”, and can therefore continue to practice: https://www.cnhc.org.uk/working-during-covid-19-latest-updates

It is up to indiviudal businesses to decide whether they are exempt under the above rules, and therefore whether to open.

If you want businesses that do not offer health services to be exempted from requirements to close we could accept a petition requesting this, but it would need to be clear what businesses you want to be exempted, and that they are not already covered by existing exemptions.

attributes.action: For all sectors to be more accountable of Climate Emergency and Sustainability.
attributes.background: To consider amending the Company Act to tighten specific requirements so government and businesses have greater accountability for their operations in respect of the impact on the environment (e.g. s.172 CA).  For the Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015  to be implemented in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling on the UK Government to, 
(i) deliver the Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015 across the UK and for this to incorporate government departments, private and third sector companies. (ii) for a review of company legislation to assist with the need to reform UK Company law and Governance to assist with the protection of our natural environment and of future generations - particularly the Company Act s.172 so that text is more specific, clear reflecting the urgency today.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the climate and sustainability, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make Ecocide a criminal offence in the UK:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332264

Require health warnings at point of purchase of fossil fuel energy eg. petrol: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333388

Allocate Government time to debate the Climate and Ecological Emergency Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561245

Introduce a carbon tax: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321854

Require packaging that clearly details the environmental impact of products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844

Require labels on all products showing water and carbon usage in manufacture: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Allow fishing to continue under the same criteria as Tier4 restrictions allowed
attributes.background: Allow fishing to continue as it did under Tier4 restrictions
attributes.additional_details:
Fishing has huge benefits to health and well-being, we are the eyes and ears on the ground with regard to environmental issues, 
Socially distanced as that is the nature of the individual angler
Also with a click and collect system of operation thousands of individual businesses can reopen saving millions

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

Under the national lockdown effective from January 6th, angling and fishing are still permitted activities, as long as wider guidance on social distancing and household mixing is adhered to. See Sport England's website for more information:
https://www.sportengland.org/how-we-can-help/coronavirus/return-play/frequently-asked-questions-national-lockdown-restrictions

attributes.action: Support The Climate Positive Baby initiative
attributes.background: Planting diverse trees to celebrate the birth of every UK newborn child, elevating and crediting the child by certifying them as a “climate positive baby” by Connecting them purposely and directly to Mother Nature and each other @ birth.  700,000 trees every year, 21 million over the next 30 years
attributes.additional_details: A 30-year commitment from the UK Government, that for the next generation, they commit to plant a diverse, colourful tree and make space for it to grow, for every child born here in the UK and encourage every country to do the same until the world grows the first generation of “climate positive babies” and it's first globally-connected, tree family network, connected in its diversity, purpose and spirit, united in its cause. We must start as we mean to go on, from birth, thank you for your time.

attributes.action: Make sanitary towels and tampons free for women!
attributes.background: Women have no choice with having periods so this petition is to help women not have to pay for a necessary item! Men get condoms for free yet women still have to pay for things we need such a tampons and sanitary towels! It is wrong! I want the government to change this!
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to change this as we should not have to pay for the necessary items we need! Women do not choose to bleed every month it is something we can not stop it is natural and yet men choose to have sex and get condoms for free!

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555551

attributes.action: To legislate to ban the burning and mismanagement of grouse moors.
attributes.background: To draw upon the clear evidence available that such practices are harmful so that a legal ban is justified.
attributes.additional_details:
Natural England's Voluntary Code of Practice has not worked and so there is a need for a statutory ban. 

Further, legislation is needed to restore Peatlands to help combat Climate Change as the Government’s Climate Change Committee has recommended..

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the burning of peatlands and management of grouse moors, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make.

We have already published a petition calling on the Government to ban the burning of peatlands, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552993

If you would also like the Government to impose new restrictions on the management of grouse moors you could start a new petition about this, but it would need to be clear what you want the Government to do.

attributes.action: Demand fair access to French vineyards in exchange for an EU trade deal
attributes.background: In the ongoing trade negotiations with the European Union, it has been stated by the French Government (and other Member States) that they expect 'fair access' to UK fishing waters. If that's the case, we would like the UK negotiating team to demand fair access to French vineyards.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is now an independent coastal state and, as such, the fish in our waters are one of our natural resources and are valuable commodities. Natural resources are almost never offered up in trade talks, so if the French want access to ours, we need access to their valuable vineyards. 

Macron et al have cited 'historic rights of European fishermen' to British waters. We cite historic rights to Western French vineyards through the Angevin Empire.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure what you mean by access to vineyards. Vineyards are cultivated land, the use of which is determined by their private owners.
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.background: Allow Zoos, Safari parks, Aquariums and Nature centres to reopen so they don't have to close indefinitely,rehome the animals or at worst euthanase them. Help make sure they have social distancing measures in place so that people can go visit.
attributes.additional_details: Make them outdoor places that people can go and visit family and friends in safely. This will greatly benefit the parks and zoos but also the public.

attributes.action: Promote natural reusable produce bags for fresh (non-packaged) foods.
attributes.background: Supermarket fresh produce is accompanied by scales and plastic bags, framed in a way to promote plastic use. Gov endorsement of natural reusable bags ie mesh bags will reduce the incentive to use plastic. The plastic bag fee has proved effective; It is time to take this a step further.
attributes.additional_details: Shops can provide these for free or sell these bags at a lower price than the 10p plastic alternatives, say 5p, to encourage the substitute. The government should promote these (adverts, news articles). The government could subsidise the provision of natural bags through a proportional increase in the plastic bag tax. The effective nudge to reduce plastic consumption is evidence this intervention can be effective. People are demanding climate change action- this policy is a positive step.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to support the use of reusable bags, but it's not clear exactly what action you want the Government to take to achieve this. It's not clear if you want the Government to run a campaign promoting the use of reusable bags, make changes to current charges, or impose additional requirements on retailers.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152

You could start a new petition about this issue, provided it is clear what action you want the Government to take.

attributes.background: These zoo's are dependent on money from visitors to keep endangered animals alive, and are quickly running out of it. They need the funds from people through the door in order to pay for the animals food, their vet bills and for the keepers who look after them.
attributes.additional_details: Zoo's are home to many endangered species of animal, bringing them to safe environments. They are protected from poachers, are given the appropriate habitat, and saved from starvation. These zoo's also enable the breeding of these animals, enhancing on population numbers. Not just for the animals, but for humans this provides a broad range of necessities. They provide the enrichment and a hobby needed for mental health. The natural history of our planet. Education, for all ages. Jobs for many

attributes.action: Allow for waste & recycling centres to be re-opened
attributes.background: Currently local waste & recycling services are closed across the country due to councils following national government guidelines. We petition the government to re-designate waste & recycling service workers as key workers during the current crisis, such that local councils can then re-open services
attributes.additional_details: The current approach taken is short sighted and is leading to increasing infection risks rather than containing them by increasing the amount of illegal fly tipping occurring across the country, and by requiring households to retain more waste materials on the their premises for longer. The nature of a waste & recycling centres involve little person to person contact in comparison to other areas already designated as key services, and so there is no reason a well managed service cannot be run.

attributes.action: Cancel A-level and GCSE exams and give students their predicted grades.
attributes.background: Exam season is fast approaching and so are the issues that occur every year with students and exams. The government should take into consideration the pressure and the effect this virus will have on schools and should cancel A-level and GCSE exams for 2020 and give students their predicted grades.
attributes.additional_details: Students are under tremendous pressure from exams and this virus is not assisting students at this time. The way the virus is spreading and the government's response of isolation it's safe to presume there will be a shortage of teachers and students. Students will miss out on valuable lesson time and this can stretch out into exam season. Previous students have not had to face issues of this nature in the past years and I don't believe its fair that 2020 students have to deal with these events.

attributes.action: Make car accidents involving cats a reportable offence
attributes.background: There are 10.9 million cats in the UK. 230,000 of these will be hit by cars annually. 25% of incidents will prove fatal, meaning 75% will rely on drivers seeking help for them if they are to survive. Cats are important, loved and valued family members to many owners and the law should reflect this.
attributes.additional_details: Cats and dogs are different species, and should be treated as such. Tacking cats to legislation already in place for dogs would not be feasible. DEFRA are in receipt of the alternative avenues for cats, which we would like to be considered further. An offence would not necessarily be the nature of the driving, but the failure to report incidents. Asking drivers be made responsible for seeking help for an injured cat should be a perfectly reasonable ask in this so called animal loving nation.

rejection.details:
We think it's similar to this petition - 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300310

If you would like something different, for example not amending the Road Traffic Act, you'll need to explain why in the petition.

In any case, we can't publish petitions that aren't created with a full name of an individual. Sorry if that wasn't clear.

attributes.action: Adapt Water Protection Laws to what they were Pre-Brexit
attributes.background: In recent years, after Brexit, Water Pollution has massively increased within river systems within England, as they have repealed most of the Water Protection laws that were EU laws. In order to have a government that cares for the people, we need our water systems to be safe from pollutants.
attributes.additional_details: Water Pollution has been scientifically proven to have adverse and damaging effects on the natural local biodiversity of environments across river basins and a dramatic effect on human health for those residing in river basins which are affected by Water Pollution. With the government's help in reinstating European Union water protection laws, we can ensure that the British Public has access to clean and safe rivers without the risk of chemical, thermal and environmentally damaging pollution

rejection.details:
It is not the case that most EU laws relating to water have been repealed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: DO NOT delay ANY carbon-reduction commitments on the journey to Net Zero 2050
attributes.background: Delivering Net Zero CARBON EMISSIONS by 2050 is a tough target. Notwithstanding all other pressures, this is the highest priority for our Nation's wellbeing and prosperity. Pressing actions must be taken NOW and continue WITH URGENCY throughout 2022-2050 to comply with the Environment Law (Nov 2021)
attributes.additional_details:
Less than 0.2% of the electorate voted for Liz Truss as PM. We DO NOT TRUST her pledge to 'ensure opportunity and prosperity for all people and future generations' as she diverts wildly from the commitments that elected this government into office.
Specifically, any redirection of post-CAP Land Management Scheme (ELMS) financing, designated to consolidate a long-term vision to revitalise natural resources, our land base and our agronomy will be welcoming climate change catastrophy. What a legacy

rejection.details:
We understand you would like to see the Government fulfil it's commitments to the 2050 net zero target for carbon emissions and not delay, but the target is set out in law and the Government have not outlined any changes or delay to that year as the target.

You could start a new petition which explains clearly which specific actions you would like the Government to take to achieve the 2050 target.

We currently have the below petition open on a similar theme, which you might like to sign:

Bring forward the Net Zero emissions target to 2030
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616392

attributes.action: Employers must prove employee can't do role before denying flexible work request
attributes.background: Employees should have the right to decide where and when they work, provided the nature of their work permits this. The current law does not protect employees sufficiently, and it should impose a high and objective threshold before an employer can deny a flexible working request.
attributes.additional_details: Many employers arbitrarily deny people the ability to work from home or flexible hours (often due to managers wishing to exercise authority or display power). Denying people the ability to work flexibly ousts sections of society (e.g., carers, people with responsibilities) from certain roles, and undermines people's quality of life and freedom of choice. It is the government's duty to protect employees from arbitrary employers to ensure every person has the same chance for every role.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Employees are already able to challenge a decision on the grounds of reasonableness. You can find out more here

https://www.gov.uk/flexible-working/after-the-application

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as changing the reasons why a request may be declined.

attributes.action: Increase the percentage of the budget spent on the military to at least 3%
attributes.background: The new threat from Russia and China requires us to respond appropriately and reverse cuts made to troop numbers as well as to support humanitarian efforts.
attributes.additional_details: Troop numbers have been steadily declining over the decades and we are in no shape to fight a global war, or any war for that matter, at this time and more funding is needed to get us up to scratch. We also require better technology and soldiers on the ground to be able to deal with humanitarian efforts in countries affected by natural disasters and on peacekeeping missions.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619184

attributes.action: Make Period Products free
attributes.background: One would think we pay for being women enough by the blood we lose out of our control. Menstruation is natural, every woman has to spend thousands in her life time on products men will never have to even think about whilst contraception can be free. Sex isn’t compulsory, we have no choice.
attributes.additional_details: Charities or funds in place are not enough. Make Pads and Tampons free! End period poverty. Stop punishing us women for something we cannot control. It’s ridiculous that we have not followed Scotland’s example. It is unjust that we suffer consequences for situations we didn’t choose. It’s not the same as toilet paper or food, bleeding isn’t something the entire population deals with. It’s painful. This doesn’t even begin to cover how common PCOS, Dysmenorrhea and Menorrhagia is. Do better.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the price of period products, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require sanitary products are made available in all public and workplace toilets: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606807

attributes.action: Period products should be free in public restrooms
attributes.background: Period products should be free in public restrooms, whether the restroom is a school one, a college one, a university one, a restaurant one, etc.
attributes.additional_details: Do you have to buy toilet paper out of dispensers? No. So why should girls and women have to buy period products? Girls and women shouldn't be charged for a natural life process and something they can't control. Especially if they're in a public restroom, and the toilet paper is free because it's needed for a natural life process, and that's what a period is, yet it costs money. They would save money on pads, tampons, underwear, and the waste that goes along with it.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606807

attributes.action: Create law that front gardens must comprise of plants
attributes.background: We need a law to protect front gardens from being completely obliterated with man-made materials, ensuring that there are plants in every single one for wildlife. At least one-third of all front gardens should be comprised of plants, be that grass, flowers, shrubs or trees.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there are no laws on how much of a front garden can be left for nature with many now being tarmacked or slabbed over, resulting in less space for wildlife and so diminishing biodiversity. In order to limit global temperature warming and increase insect populations, we need to be utilising this vital space of the front garden to take it back to what it should be - a front garden. We need more plants and trees to act as carbon stores, and more flowers for pollinators.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how to maintain domestic gardens are a matter for the homeowner, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.background: Mental Wellbeing Classes to be taught in ALL schools as part of the national curriculum. Imagine if children were taught from day 1 of starting school that their mental health was as important as their physical health (which they do PE for) this would come naturally and help our children for life.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Curriculum (which I also think is very outdated and needs a complete overhaul to suit the world/children we have right now)
I believe the pressure schools and children have on them to perform to certain levels is having a detrimental impact on everyones mental health - the happier and safer the child feels the more effective their brains perform meaning better results anyway. Every child deserves to have the tools given to help them in life, especially their mental wellbeing.

attributes.action: Ban all products or services arising from deforestation
attributes.background: Deforestation is causing direct harm to the natural habitat of thousands of indigenous species of animals.  Deforestation is also cutting off the oxygen supply to the world and adding huge volume of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK should no longer play any part in the intentional or unintentional destruction of ancient forests around the world, whether directly or indirectly, in the pursuit of economic or private business interests.

attributes.action: Establish Cabinet Office Briefing Rooms (COBR) for the climate emergency.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has been a global leader in the past and we have the opportunity to show real leadership to tackle the climate change crisis, biodiversity loss and pollution of nature and the impacts on or own health and well being.  We need emergency action and planning establishing COBR.
attributes.additional_details: The government has declared a climate emergency and the science is screaming at us we have to change now, as an emergency. COP 26 has just about kept "1.5" alive, but we need action. COBR is required to bring the planners, military strategists, business, individuals, innovators, and government together to set the plan to tackle the crisis and tell the world we are acting post COP 26 and listening to the public. Committees are not the answer for an emergency, we need action right now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Government action on climate change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

COBR (or COBRA) is shorthand for the Civil Contingencies Committee that is convened to handle matters of national emergency or major disruption, and the briefing rooms referred to in the acronym are located in Whitehall.

There are already Cabinet Committees on Climate Action Strategy and Climate Action Implementation, but we could accept a petition calling on the Government to schedule COBR meetings to address the climate emergency, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.additional_details: The move is not backed by any scientific reason and therefore is clearly only discriminatory and coercive towards vaccination. If lateral flow tests are valid and effective in detecting potential spreaders and positive results should be trusted, that's true regardless of the vaccination status of the individual. Natural immunity in the UK unfortunately is treated as not having immunity, but several studies are confirming the opposite. https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.08.24.21262415v1

We humbly ask the government to please reconsider exemption of individuals who have been exposed to Covid and have acquired immunity therein from mandatory vaccination.
Rest assured, we will still adhere to measures  preventing the spread of the virus such us social distancing,use of PPEs & hygiene

attributes.action: To enact laws that protect British citizens from online racial abuse and hatred
attributes.background: The laws surrounding online abuse and hatred have become outdated and insufficient in the modern age.  Parliament should enact laws that would categorize offences of this nature in terms of seriousness, harm and culpability so that appropriate sentences can be passed on those found guilty
attributes.additional_details: It is now apparent that the laws surrounding online abuse are not sufficient to protect British nationals in the ever developing age of social media. This is an opportunity for British government to lead the world once again in terms of equality and protecting others from harm. Especially in light of the abuse received by black English footballers in the fallout after the loss at Euro 2021 the time is right and the public attitude is there to support widespread change for the betterment of all.

attributes.action: Fix the few Hyper-Emitting Powerplants which create 52% of CO2 Emissions
attributes.background:
Just 5% of the world’s power plants account for almost three-quarters of carbon emissions from electricity generation.
The UK could lead the charge in a crackdown on these few powerplants to make them more efficient.
attributes.additional_details:
This would result in a 25% decrease of emissions and switching their fuel source from coal or oil to natural gas could cut global emissions by almost 30%.
This would be a massive step forward for a reasonably small cost.
We're seeing our planet become more dangerous every day and our personal lifestyle choices are not enough to change this. 
We have to collaborate with other countries and crackdown on these super-polluters.

rejection.details:

If there are particular actions you would like the Government to take in respect of UK-based power plants you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all inhumane glue traps in the UK
attributes.background: To prevent the suffering of harmless insects, and to ensure the biodiversity of our natural environments, I am campaigning to ban all glue traps in the UK. These include pheromone traps, wardrobe glue traps (for harmless clothes moths), fly strips and ant traps.
attributes.additional_details: Glue traps are a commonly used, inhumane, and cruel method of repelling insects such as moth and flies. Tree glue traps, pheromone traps, and fly strips are just a few of these abominable methods of repelling insects, and all cause long, slow deaths for the poor creatures that succumb to them. The traps are also reducing biodiversity within our natural environments, by removing reliable food sources for creatures like owls, birds and bats.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560288

attributes.action: Create legislation that enforces football clubs to share ownership with fans
attributes.background: Sadly, our football clubs are being squeezed for every penny by owners with little regard for the clubs and more importantly the fans. Give greater control to the fans of their clubs, be it the german style 50+1 rule or something of a similar nature.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of 'Super League Gate' where billionaire owners are attempting to squeeze more and more money from the biggest clubs and monopolize their respective leagues, it is now time to wrestle back control of our clubs.

Football is not a business, it is a passion, where the fans are the least represented. It is time now to stop owners from bleeding our clubs dry and give fans greater power with the running of their clubs.

attributes.action: Make public sexual harassment a criminal offense in the UK
attributes.background: Verbal harassment of a sexual nature in public is largely too common and helps to breed an acception of even more severe forms of sexual harassment, which are already deemed a criminal offense. Making sure people know the reality of their actions have is the first step in creating a safer society
attributes.additional_details: The recent statistic by UN Women UK released a shocking statistic that 97% of women have been sexually harassed. This study included public harassment, and is the most common form. Outlining how severe even this form of harassment is by enforcing law against it will not only help people to feel comfortable opening up about their experience, but will also act as a deterrent or realisation for those who deem it ok to verbally harass people publicly.
